channel.title: A few questions
channel.description:
How can I read a .class file? It looks like a bunch of random symbols when I open it in notepad.
How can I change an NPC's name? I tried changing it in npc.cfg but nothing changed ingame.
Where can I find all of the ingame commands (::command) for my server? What folder/file?
Where does all of the NPC/Item/Object info come from? The config files barely have anything.

item.title: A few questions
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

zerogordo:

For the class file as far as I know although I may be wrong I think you have to buy one but use google

Dude, wtf are you talking about? Buying a class file? If you would have read Chassy’s reply:

Chassy13:

You don’t need to read a .class file. This is what the server reads from. When you compile .java files, it edits the class files so Java can read it. Although if you really want to make the .class file a .java file, you can download a decompiler.

Read full topic

item.title: A few questions
item.dc:creator: @zerogordo zerogordo
item.description:
@zerogordo wrote:

For the class file as far as I know although I may be wrong I think you have to buy one but use google

For the commands try going into client.java and press ctrl+f and type either equalsignorecase or search for command.startswith I think although I may be wrong

Read full topic

item.title: A few questions
item.dc:creator: @darkman210 darkman210
item.description:
@darkman210 wrote:

to delete you need coords.

search public void Deletethatobject

under that add

deletethatobject(x, y) // door

just add coords to tht code.

hope this helps. if you have any more questions just ask and ill see what i can do to help.

Read full topic

item.title: A few questions
item.dc:creator: @kmansnoob kmansnoob
item.description:
@kmansnoob wrote:

Thanks guys. I’ve figured out most of this stuff with your help. My server is turning out nice but I got a few more if you don’t mind.

I set my NPC at a coordinate, specified the walking area, but he still just stands there. I think I’m messing up under “Walk Type”. I’ve tried both 1 and 2 but they haven’t done anything.

Whenever I close a door, it can’t be opened again. How can I make it closable. Or if you don’t know, how can I delete the door? (I tried “Delete Global Object” but it was still there.)

Read full topic

item.title: A few questions
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“kmansnoob, post:1, topic:259897”]How can I read a .class file? It looks like a bunch of random symbols when I open it in notepad.

How can I change an NPC’s name? I tried changing it in npc.cfg but nothing changed ingame.

Where can I find all of the ingame commands (::command) for my server? What folder/file?

Where does all of the NPC/Item/Object info come from? The config files barely have anything.[/quote]

You don’t need to read a .class file. This is what the server reads from. When you compile .java files, it edits the class files so Java can read it. Although if you really want to make the .class file a .java file, you can download a decompiler.

That is client-sided.

Your customCommand method in the client class.

What do you mean? A lot of it comes from the client class and NPCHandler. Most .cfg files are for loading.

Read full topic

item.title: A few questions
item.dc:creator: @darkman210 darkman210
item.description:
@darkman210 wrote:

Your commands are found in client.java.

just search for if.command

that should take you to commands.

If not, then if you know one of the commands in the game then search for the name like if you knew ::starter. Just search for starter.

Read full topic
